title: Weak Bithdate Validation Implemented on Sign Up

profile.name: Khan Academy
profile.about: Start learning now. Completely free, forever.

vulnerability_information_html:
The Birthdate Field on the KhanAcademy's Sign Up page for new users has the year range from 2017 to 1897.

However, while signing up for a new account, I was able to set the year to 1033 by manipulating the data being sent to the server and the account was successfully created. I can also confirm the year by checking the settings page of my account. Please refer to the screenshots for information.



I was also able to create a Child account with the same bug. Attaching the screenshot where the system says "You don't have an email address connected to this Khan Academy account. Since you're 1017 years old, you can connect an email address to your account, which will unlink it from your parent's account.".

Suggestion: Proper validation should be implemented on Birthdate field so that the user is not able to set any year other than what is being displayed on the dropdown.

activities.message: That's a fun trick! That said, this doesn't cause us any security issues -- it doesn't negatively affect other users, and to the extent users are going to falsify their age it doesn't really matter to us if they claim to be 120 or 1120.  We appreciate the report, so if you send me your Khan Academy account email or username I'd be happy to give you our [Friendly Hacker](https://www.khanacademy.org/badges/friendly-hacker) badge.

activities.message:
Totally agree. It's not a security issue but I find the bug to be quite funny so thought of reporting it to you guys and especially I really appreciate what Khan Academy is doing :)
My Khan Academy account username is sreekanthpillai.
